dct_title_s: Harum opera utitur GEOGRAPHIA ARTIFICIOSA ad suas Delineationes prius ex Globo in Globum postea ex Globo in Planum transferendas
dct_description_sm: Title page displays contemporary influence of science, discovery and exploration.

Central globe, showing "California" as large island west of "America Boreal", and showing "Australis"(South America), and western part of Africa and Europe, standing on table surrounded by 6 labelled figures: "TOPOGRAPHIA", "HISTORIA [and] GEOGRAPHICA CONSETIAT.", "Ad Regulam et Mensuram Geometrica", "Ad OCVLVM", "Conspiret Calculus.", and "Respondeat Observatio Cœlestis."
Above central figure, at page top, is "GEOGRAPHIA ARTIFICIOSA." on ribbon.

From: Geographia artificialis. Sive globi terraquei geographice repræsentandi artificium. Authore P. Henrico Scherer, Societatis Jesu. Pars V. Sumptibus Joannis Caspari Bencard, Bibliopolæ Academiæ. Monarchii, Typis, Mariæ Magdalenæ Rauchin Viduæ, Anno M.DCCIII. : Atlas Novus exhibens orbem terraqueum per naturæ opera, historiæ novæ ac veteris monumenta, artisque geographicæ leges et præcepta. Hoc est: Geographic universa in septem partes contracta, et instructa ducentis fere chartis geographicis, ac figuris, cujus; Pars V ... Geographia artificialis. 7 parts (pars) published 1702-10; reissued 1730-37.
